column4: can anyone tell me what i can do to force my ubuntu install to NOT start anything graphical on boot up? i log in remotely with freenx and want to free up resources
changin runlevel?
yes i think thats what i want
you can config your boot runlevel in /etc/inittab
do you know of a page that has detailed info on editing that file? i don't quite understand how it works, even with the comments
no. but you can change the line bout default runlevel
change the number after id:
my default runlevel appears to be 2... isn't that one below the normal graphical start up runlevel?
then go to /etc/rc$yournumber and do "mv S13gdm K13gdm"
2 is the default runlevel
you can change to 3 for example, and then modify /etc/rc3.d
renaming S13gdm to K13gdm
i used that mv S13gdm K13gdm command. next time i boot it will stay at console then?
this way you have a text mode boot
